title: When Driving becomes Writing (Video)
content:
<object width="501" height="282"><param name="allowfullscreen" value="true">
<param name="allowscriptaccess" value="always">
<param name="movie" value="http://vimeo.com/moogaloop.swf?clip_id=5233789&server=vimeo.com&show_title=1&show_byline=1&show_portrait=0&color=00adef&fullscreen=1">
<embed src="/web/20130828190140oe_/http://vimeo.com/moogaloop.swf?clip_id=5233789&server=vimeo.com&show_title=1&show_byline=1&show_portrait=0&color=00adef&fullscreen=1" type="application/x-shockwave-flash" allowfullscreen="true" allowscriptaccess="always" width="501" height="282"></embed></object>

You can download the free font: [http://nl.toyota.be/iqfont](http://web.archive.org/web/20130828190140/http:/nl.toyota.be/iqfont)
author: Joe Pemberton

comments.content: Great idea! Unfortunately they didn't try this with only two points. It would have resulted in nicer letterforms, with contrast.
Why would you digitize this? It looks like a font that anyone would drawn if they were bored, with a handful of crayons.

_\> Why would you digitize this? It looks like a font that anyone would drawn if they were bored, with a handful of crayons._

I don’t like the result, but maybe the important thing is the process and the concept behind it.

Great idea. Can I know what font it is :-) Could have been done as a full time ad where it would have won several awards.

[Defensive Driving](http://web.archive.org/web/20130828190140/http:/www.allprodriving.com/)

This looks fun.

Although I might not do this for my own design to be released, (agree with Wesley- You can achieve similar results by all kind of methods- rolling a boat on still water, have your son ride his bicycle on a wet ground after rain, paint an ant black and get it to trace some letter tracks with sugar on it, etc... they are pretty much the same thing. ) however, I don't mind if Toyota were to commission me to do it and pay me big, at the same time I can have some fun as well... why not?

weng

Great, now they're using TWO moving fronts...

hhp
